content.description:
Amazing big moves on good holds leads to a crimpy finish, easier than it looks.
Named after Nitin Chidambaram.

Follows the obvious arete just right of the "Start of the line".
6 bolts

An obvious chimney/crack left of " Start of the Line": A little kid climb that can be easily set up for TR. Solo an obvious crack/chimney to a belay station. Stick in a #4 or 5 if you feel you need it. Now your kids can have fun too!
Named after Tim Taylor`s daughter Kiriah.

gear up to #5

climbs.name: Paxito
climbs.fa: Prep and FA,  Konstantin Stoletov, July 2020

content.description:
A little tricky climb under the roof. Can be your kid first lead or TR. Always dry and overbolted. One can stick clip bolt #3 from the ground. Set up a TR for your kid or use it a warm up for rainy day while waiting for stuff to dry. Left of "Start of the Line" after big roof.
Named after Konstantin`s son Paxi.

4 bolts

This line splits slightly right from the mid-height knee-bar on the original line "Pull Harder"

3 sections to the climb:

1. Approach: 3 m, 2 bolts (~5.10), ~6 moves up an easy flake onto a no hands ledge. If you want to climb 5.13, take off your shirt here.
2. "Pull Harder" crux 1, 10 m, 6 bolts (5.13a), ~22 moves to the knee bar rest and branch point. If you haven't taken your shirt off yet, this is going to be strenuous but you might be able to do it!
3. Pull Hard crux 2, 10 m, 3 bolts (~5.12), Stand up out of your knee bar to clip the bolt up and just a touch to the right. Pull a powerful boulder along the weakness to get out of the harsh overhang to easier, closer to vertical rock. After you clip your next bolt, the climb is yours to botch!

Counter-weighted rap to recover your draws and get your shirt off the ground. Good job.

To reduce rope drag/protect your rope, stick clip the second bolt and long draw bolts 6, 8 (knee bar bolt), 9, 10.



As you walk up to the overhang, this is the second line from the right- shared start with "Start of the Line"/"Pull Harder", splits off of Pull harder at bolt 8 (cannot be seen from ground). Climbtech perma on bolt 4 and a handful of "crag draws"

11 bolts, 2 bolt anchor

An obvious line that goes right up the middle of the overhang on a right facing weakness/giant flake.  Same start as "Start of the line" but go straight up and pull as hard as you can! Combination of overhanging slopers, knee bars and more.

Stay left along the larger flake/weakness- the line splits ~13 m off the deck. The right branch is "Pull Hard"

Named after Californian group of friends who called themselves "Pull harder".



10 bolts + 2 permas, rap rings

climbs.name: Start of the line
climbs.fa: PREP: K. Stoletov, FA: V. Mayoraz 2018

content.description:
Beautiful power endurance route that follows the obvious line in the middle of the wall. Take some alpine draws to reduce drag.

Obvious line following the flake in the middle of overhang. Start at the powerful layback flake.
10 bolts

climbs.name: Start of the line extension
climbs.fa: PREP: K. Stoletov, FA: V. Mayoraz 2018

content.description:
Amazing crimpy-pumpy extension on perfect blue limestone all the way to the top. 70m rope.

same like for "Start of the line"
16 bolts

The striking ~30 degree overhang where the first lines of Little Russia were bolted. A couple lines on the left for the kids, and more serious lines for the gym punks to the right. Climbs are gymnastic and generally feature good holds. 

Cleaning these lines was very difficult due to the extreme overhang. If you deviate at all from the line you'll find loose rock- just make sure no one is under you when you're climbing. 

Get's a splash of morning sun. Some holds leak in early season or after heavy rain.
